page.title: 14NORTH KILWORTH CHURCH
page.content: {ST.ANDREW'S CHURCH} {++++++++++++++++++ There has been a church on this site in North Kilworth since before 1200. The present church stands as it was after an extensive restoration and extension in the 1870s.At that time the East aisle was added.The arches on the West side of the nave are much older,possibly C13th. The pulpit,of painted oak(red and blue),is called "The Armada Pulpit", tradition has it that it came from a Spanish galleon,or that is was built from a galleon's timbers. The tower has six bells,and the best stained glass in the church.Â£20,000 was raised by 1983 to repair the spire The organ was renovated in 1984. The Rector is the Rev.d S.W.Doggett M.B.E.,T.D.,M.A.,at present Rural Dean of the Guthlaxton II Deanery.
